natural solution: Since $SUR$ is a straight line, then $\angle RUV = 180^\circ - \angle SUV = 180^\circ - 120^\circ = 60^\circ$. Since $PW$ and $QX$ are parallel, then $\angle RVW = \angle VTX = 112^\circ$. Since $UVW$ is a straight line, then $\angle RVU = 180^\circ - \angle RVW = 180^\circ - 112^\circ = 68^\circ$.
Since the measures of the angles in a triangle add to $180^\circ$, then \[ \angle URV = 180^\circ - \angle RUV - \angle RVU = 180^\circ - 60^\circ - 68^\circ = \boxed{52^\circ}. \]
